results.title: Mentally handicapped children growing up
results.brief_description: An experiment at Brooklands. Contrasts overcrowded ward in a public hospital where hard worked staff have no time to train the children in self-help and the family activity style of training at Brooklands. Small groups with a ‘mother’ learn some independence by living together as families; the active outdoor life enables them to become more and more independent.

results.title: Mental patients' association
results.creator_credit: Richard Patton, John Taylor, Peter Jones, Shelah Reljic and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The Mental Patients Association was set up to deal with mental patients in the period immediately after discharge from hospital. They have established a “drop-in” centre to help patients in this transitory period. Interviews members of the association, discusses the problems encountered in a mental hospital. Shows the work and activities of the association.

results.title: Mental
results.headline_credit: Australia and United States of America, 2012
results.brief_description: A charismatic, crazy hothead transforms a family’s life when she becomes the nanny of five girls.

constellations_other.name: Atari’s Basketball
constellations_other.description: Released in 1979, just in time for the arcade heydays of the early 1980s, Atari’s Basketball was the first basketball game to use a trackball as the input mechanic and a 45-degree angled side view. This set the standard for basketball games that followed.

results.title: Menopause: the truth, the rumours and you
results.creator_credit: Margaret Slaght, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and The National and The Journal
results.brief_description: An international award winning two part documentary featuring Germaine Germaine Greer which explores myths and misconceptions about menopause, the common problems women experience and investigates alternative therapies.

results.title: Menopause: myths and realities
results.creator_credit: Zedda Burnford, Paul Burnford and Wexler Film Productions
results.brief_description: This program shows six women going through the various stages and experiencing the myriad of menopausal symptoms. The program is positive - solutions are offered and avenues for help are explored.

results.title: Mendel: father of genetics
results.brief_description: This film clearly demonstrates Mendel’s theory, which shows that characteristics are inherited according to a mathematical pattern having dominant and recessive strains, rather than through inheritance of acquired characteristics or blending of characteristics. Suitable for upper secondary levels.

results.title: Menace Sous la Mer (Ep.6)
results.brief_description:
Historian Jean-Jacques Antier retraces the evolution of submarine engineering, from the first prototype built by David Buchnell (The Turtle) to the latest nuclear-powered models. This episode also covers France’s nuclear defense policy and its testing facility on Mururoa atoll.

Credits: Directors, writers, Daniel Costelle, Jean-Marc Leblon ; photography, Jean-Claude Larrieu, Roland Bernard ; technical adviser, Michel Mollat.

results.title: Menace
results.brief_description: The early Cold War years in Australia were characterised by attempts to suppress political dissent including the banning of the Communist Party. Here we see the experience from the perspective of those who defended democratic freedoms. This is a critical look at the Australian political scene from the end of World War II to the commencement of hostilities in Korea. Emphasis is placed on the events surrounding the Communist party Dissolution Bill, the High Court judgement declaring the Act invalid and the 1951 referendum defeat in which Prime Minister Menzies unsuccessfully asked the Australian people to change the constitution and make the Communist Part Dissolution Bill law.

results.title: Men, machines and the secretary
results.creator_credit: Bill Young, Ian Rosenbloom and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Systems Organisation the Management of Complexity”.
Examines the London headquarters of Texaco, a multi-national oil company, to case study the introduction of word processors which demanded a major reorganisation of the company’s use of secretaries.

results.title: Men without faces
results.creator_credit: Dennis A. Hill and New South Wales. Dept. of Prisons
results.brief_description: This film describes the NSW penal system and explains the efforts made by prison officers to rehabilitate prisoners. Shows how hardened prisoners enter Grafton Gaol, a prison of bars and locks, while those who show promise of reforming are sent to training centres in Goulbourn, Berrima and Emu Plains where they are taught trades and how to live in a community, preparation for the day of their release.
